page.title: 05FARMING IN GENERAL
page.content: Farming in this area is mainly restricted to cattle and sheep.The sheep are all kept on the high ground such as the nearby mountains,but the cattle are lower in the valleys and feed on the lush grass. to feed these animals in winter a lot of silage is made,hay although once popular is now rarely made. Very little ploughing is done although a bit of ground is ploughed on the very flat grounds where oil seed rape is grown,besides oil seed rape hardly any alternative crops are grown,a little woodand surrounds the area but this is not significant.The farmers are reasonably up to date with machinery although big machines are rarely used,mainly a tractor is used to feed the sheep or load the silage etc.
